member.name: T:Ab3d.Assimp.AssimpWpfExporter
member.summary: AssimpWpfExporter class can be used to export the WPF 3D scene to many different file formats.

remarks.para: AssimpWpfExporter class can be used to export the WPF 3D scene to many different file formats.

The AssimpWpfExporter uses an open source assimp library to do the export. Therefore in the current step the WPF 3D objects are converted into Assimp Scene object. Then the export method on assimp scene is called.
To get a list of supported file formats check the .

member.name: P:Ab3d.Assimp.Common.Triangulator.IsClockwise
member.summary: Gets a boolean that specifies if the specified points are oriented in clockwise direction.

remarks.para: IsClockwise gets a boolean that specifies if the specified points are oriented in clockwise direction.
This property is useful when creating extruded objects from polygons - if the IsClockwise is false, the normals for the extruded object need to be flipped.

member.name: P:Ab3d.Assimp.Common.Triangulator.IsPolygonConvex
member.summary: Gets a boolean that specifies if the specified points define a convex polygon. In convex polygon every internal angle is less than or equal to 180 degrees and every line segment between two vertices remains inside or on the boundary of the polygon. For example square is convex, but star is not (it is concave).

member.name: P:Ab3d.Assimp.Common.Triangulator.PolygonArea
member.summary: Gets a double that specifies the area defined by the specified points.

member.summary: Constructor.

list of indexes in the points list that define the polygon.

member.name: M:Ab3d.Assimp.Common.Triangulator.CreateTriangleIndices
member.summary: CreateTriangleIndices method triangulates the specified points and creates a list of triangle indices that define the polygon.
member.exception: FormatException is thrown when the points define an invalid polygon - usually when the polygon lines intersect each other.
member.returns: List of triangle indices that define the polygon

member.name: M:Ab3d.Assimp.Common.Triangulator.Triangulate(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Windows.Point})
member.summary: Triangulate method triangulates the specified points and creates a list of triangle indices that define the polygon.
member.param: List of triangle indices that define the polygon
member.exception: FormatException is thrown when the points define an invalid polygon - usually when the polygon lines intersect each other.
member.returns: List of triangle indices that define the polygon

member.name: M:Ab3d.Assimp.Common.Triangulator.Project3DPositionTo2D(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D},System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Int32})
member.summary: Returns a List of 2D points that are created with projecting the 3D positions onto the xy, xz or yz plane (removing one of the coordinates). The plane is determined with checking the normal of the first triangle and determining which component of the normal vector is the biggest (this coordinate is removing). This requires that the positions lie on the same plane. Input positions and polygonIndices must not be null or have less that 3 elements.
member.param: indexes of positions that define the positions that will be used in this method
member.returns: List of 2D Positions

member.summary: Gets a list of WPF Materials from Assimp Scene object.

member.summary: Gets or sets a material that is used as default material (when material is not specified in the model file)

member.name: P:Ab3d.Assimp.AssimpWpfConverter.ForceConvertToRightHandedCoordinateSystem
member.summary: Gets or sets a Booleand that specifies if we always do a convertion from left to right handed coordinate system.

remarks.para: ForceConvertToRightHandedCoordinateSystem gets or sets a Booleand that specifies if we always do a convertion from left to right handed coordinate system.
WPF uses right handed coordinate system - the Z axis points away from the screen. DirectX uses left handed coordinate system - there the Z axis points into the screen.

member.name: P:Ab3d.Assimp.AssimpWpfConverter.ReadPolygonIndices
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean that specifies if PolygonIndicesProperty is set to the created MeshGeometry3D objects. This property defines the indexes of positions that define mesh polygons. This property is used only when the assimp scene was not read with Triangulation post process and when the Ab3d.PowerToys library is referenced.

member.name: P:Ab3d.Assimp.AssimpWpfConverter.UseSimpleTriangulation
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean that specifies if simple triangle fan triangulation is used instead of standard triangulation. This property is used only when the 3D model is not triangulated by assimp importer (when Triangulate PostProcessSteps is not used). Default value is false.

remarks.para: UseSimpleTriangulation gets or sets a Boolean that specifies if simple triangle fan triangulation is used instead of standard triangulation.
Simple triangle fan triangulation is much faster, but can correctly triangulate only convex polygons. Standard triangulation is much slower but can triangulate convex and concave polygons.
This property is used only when the 3D model is not triangulated by assimp importer (when Triangulate PostProcessSteps is not used).
By default standard triangulation is used but if you know that the read models use only convex polygons, you can speed up reading 3D models with setting UseSimpleTriangulation to true.

member.name: P:Ab3d.Assimp.AssimpWpfConverter.BitmapCacheOption
member.summary: Gets or sets a BitmapCacheOption that is used when creating bitmaps from files. Default value is OnLoad that caches the image in memory at load time (this does not lock the image file name).

member.name: P:Ab3d.Assimp.AssimpWpfConverter.RemoveEmptyModel3DGroups
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolena that specifies if Model3DGroups without any child objects are removed from the imported scene. Default value is true.

member.name: M:Ab3d.Assimp.AssimpWpfConverter.CheckTextureFileName(System.String)
member.summary: CheckTextureFileName checks the texture file name and if file does not exist or is not in supported file format tries to find another file that can be used instead. Returns the file name that can be used to create WPF texture. If no file can be found, null is returned. The method can be overridden.

remarks.para: CheckTextureFileName checks the texture file name and if file does not exist or is not in supported file format tries to find another file that can be used instead. Returns the file name that can be used to create WPF texture. If no file can be found, null is returned.
The method first checks if file extension is supported image format for WPF.

If file format is supported, then method checks if file exist on disk. If it exists then we can use this file and the original textureFileName is returned. If file does not exist, then it is checked if the file name was written in old 8.3 file name format, but on disk a file with longer name exist. In this case the existing file name is returned.
If file format is not supported, then it is checked if there is another file on disk with supported file format. In that case the supported file name is returned.

member.param: full path and file name for texture file
member.returns: file name that can be used to create WPF texture or null if no file can be found

member.name: T:Ab3d.Visuals.AssimpModelVisual3D
member.summary: AssimpModelVisual3D is a Visual3D class that shows 3D models that are read from almost any 3D file format with Assimp library.

remarks.para: AssimpModelVisual3D is a Visual3D class that shows 3D models that are read from almost any 3D file format with Assimp library.
The source of the obj file is specified with property.
The read 3D model is positioned according to the and properties.

If the PositionType is set to Center (default), the 3D model will be position so that its center will be at the Position coordinates. If the PositionType is set to BottomCenter, the 3D model will be positioned above the Position coordinates.
The size of the shown object is controlled by the , , and properties.

By default all the SizeX, SizeY and SizeZ are set to -1. This means that the original size of the object is used. But if the SizeX is set to let's say 100, the object would be scaled so its SizeX would be 100.

If PreserveScaleAspectRatio is true (default), than the aspect ratio of the 3D model is preserved. This means that the model is stretched to one side mode than to the other - the scale is evenly set to all the axis. This also means that if all SizeX, SizeY and SizeZ are defined, the object will be scaled so it will not exceed and of the specified sizes.

If PreserveScaleAspectRatio is false, than the aspect ration of the 3D model will not be preserved. In this case the SizeX, SizeY and SizeZ will be applied so the object will be exactly the size of the specified sizes.

example.para: Before using AssimpModelVisual3D the following namespace declaration has to be added to the root xaml element:
Now the AssimpModelVisual3D can be used in XAML. The following example shown a 3D model from ab3d.dae file. The model's center is positioned at (-250, 0, 0) and its size is set so its SizeX is 80:
The following code shows the same mode, but this time it is custom sized:
example.code: <assimpVisuals:AssimpModelVisual3D Source="/Resources/ab3d.dae" SizeX="50" SizeY="30" SizeZ="40" PreserveScaleAspectRatio="False" Position="0 40 0" PositionType="Center"/>

member.name: P:Ab3d.Visuals.AssimpModelVisual3D.TexturesPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the path where the textures are located. If null or "" the path of the obj file is used. It is also possible to set TexturesPath to url of the textures (http://...) or to the application resources ("pack://application:,,,/XAMLBrowserApplication1;component/models")

member.name: P:Ab3d.Visuals.AssimpModelVisual3D.SizeX
member.summary: Gets or sets the size in of the 3D model in X dimension.

remarks.para: The default value of SizeX is -1. This means that the original X Size of the object is preserved.
How the SizeX is applied to the shown model depends on the property.
If it is false, than the x size of the shown object will be the same as the specified SizeX (if -1 than the original object x size is used).

If PreserveScaleAspectRatio is true (by default), than the aspect ratio of the 3D model is preserved. This means that the model is stretched to one side mode than to the other - the scale is evenly set to all the axis. This also means that if all SizeX, SizeY and SizeZ are defined, the object will be scaled so it will not exceed and of the specified sizes.

example.para: The following example shown a 3D model from ab3d.obj file. The model's center is positioned at (-250, 0, 0) and its size is set so its SizeX is 80. Note that by default the PreserveScaleAspectRatio is set to true.
The following code shows the same mode, but this time it is custom sized:
example.code: <AssimpModelVisual3D:AssimpModelVisual3D Source="/Resources/ab3d.obj" SizeX="50" SizeY="30" SizeZ="40" PreserveScaleAspectRatio="False" Position="0 40 0" PositionType="Center"/>

member.name: F:Ab3d.Visuals.AssimpModelVisual3D.SizeXProperty
member.summary: SizeXProperty

member.summary: Gets or sets the size in of the 3D model in Y dimension.

remarks.para: The default value of SizeY is -1. This means that the original Y Size of the object is preserved.
How the SizeY is applied to the shown model depends on the property.
If it is false, than the y size of the shown object will be the same as the specified SizeY (if -1 than the original object y size is used).

If PreserveScaleAspectRatio is true (by default), than the aspect ratio of the 3D model is preserved. This means that the model is stretched to one side mode than to the other - the scale is evenly set to all the axis. This also means that if all SizeX, SizeY and SizeZ are defined, the object will be scaled so it will not exceed and of the specified sizes.

example.para: The following example shown a 3D model from ab3d.obj file. The model's center is positioned at (-250, 0, 0) and its size is set so its SizeX is 80. Note that by default the PreserveScaleAspectRatio is set to true.
The following code shows the same mode, but this time it is custom sized:
example.code: <AssimpModelVisual3D:AssimpModelVisual3D Source="/Resources/ab3d.obj" SizeX="50" SizeY="30" SizeZ="40" PreserveScaleAspectRatio="False" Position="0 40 0" PositionType="Center"/>

member.name: P:Ab3d.Visuals.AssimpModelVisual3D.SizeZ
member.summary: Gets or sets the size in of the 3D model in Z dimension.

remarks.para: The default value of SizeZ is -1. This means that the original Z Size of the object is preserved.
How the SizeZ is applied to the shown model depends on the property.
If it is false, than the z size of the shown object will be the same as the specified SizeZ (if -1 than the original object z size is used).

If PreserveScaleAspectRatio is true (by default), than the aspect ratio of the 3D model is preserved. This means that the model is stretched to one side mode than to the other - the scale is evenly set to all the axis. This also means that if all SizeX, SizeY and SizeZ are defined, the object will be scaled so it will not exceed and of the specified sizes.

example.para: The following example shown a 3D model from ab3d.obj file. The model's center is positioned at (-250, 0, 0) and its size is set so its SizeX is 80. Note that by default the PreserveScaleAspectRatio is set to true.
The following code shows the same mode, but this time it is custom sized:
example.code: <AssimpModelVisual3D:AssimpModelVisual3D Source="/Resources/ab3d.obj" SizeX="50" SizeY="30" SizeZ="40" PreserveScaleAspectRatio="False" Position="0 40 0" PositionType="Center"/>

member.name: P:Ab3d.Visuals.AssimpModelVisual3D.PreserveScaleAspectRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean that specifies if the 3D model is scaled so its aspect ratio is preserved (the ratio between width, height and depth of the object).

remarks.para: The size of the shown object is controlled by the , , and properties.

By default all the SizeX, SizeY and SizeZ are set to -1. This means that the original size of the object is used. But if the SizeX is set to let's say 100, the object would be scaled so its SizeX would be 100.

If PreserveScaleAspectRatio is true (default), than the aspect ratio of the 3D model is preserved. This means that the model is stretched to one side mode than to the other - the scale is evenly set to all the axis. This also means that if all SizeX, SizeY and SizeZ are defined, the object will be scaled so it will not exceed and of the specified sizes.

If PreserveScaleAspectRatio is false, than the aspect ration of the 3D model will not be preserved. In this case the SizeX, SizeY and SizeZ will be applied so the object will be exactly the size of the specified sizes.

example.para: The following example shown a 3D model from ab3d.obj file. The model's center is positioned at (-250, 0, 0) and its size is set so its SizeX is 80. Note that by default the PreserveScaleAspectRatio is set to true.
The following code shows the same mode, but this time it is custom sized:
example.code: <AssimpModelVisual3D:AssimpModelVisual3D Source="/Resources/ab3d.obj" SizeX="50" SizeY="30" SizeZ="40" PreserveScaleAspectRatio="False" Position="0 40 0" PositionType="Center"/>

member.name: F:Ab3d.Visuals.AssimpModelVisual3D.PreserveScaleAspectRatioProperty
member.summary: PreserveScaleAspectRatioProperty

member.name: P:Ab3d.Visuals.AssimpModelVisual3D.DefaultMaterial
member.summary: Gets or sets the default material that is used when the material is not defined in obj file. The property must be set before the file is read.

member.name: E:Ab3d.Visuals.AssimpModelVisual3D.BeforeReadingFile
member.summary: BeforeReadingFile event occurs after the UsedAssimpWpfImporter has been created and before the actual file has been read.

remarks.para: The BeforeReadingFile is useful if you want to set some special properties on the object before it reads the file.

member.name: M:Ab3d.Visuals.AssimpModelVisual3D.SetModelScale

member.name: M:Ab3d.Visuals.AssimpModelVisual3D.UpdateContentIfNotInitializing
member.summary: Recreates the models if the Visual3D is visible (IsVisible is true) and it is not initializing (between BeginInit and EndInit)
